title: PICU New Graduate Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics (Kansas City, MO) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied soon after the application period opened. The application required that you submit a video interview within 48 hours. The video interview was pretty standard. It consisted of behavioral questions, I think there were 7 or so. You had 30 seconds to prepare yourself, once the question displayed, before the video started recording. I received an email a couple of weeks later inviting me to an in-person interview. I was so so excited!! 

The in-person interview consisted of two separate interviews, one was with two PICU leaders and one was with three nurses from the unit (a mix of charge and staff). They asked approx 10-15 questions per interview. The questions came from a big packet, which I assume was used for all interviewees. The questions all began to run together and by the end I felt like I didn't even know what I was talking about. It was pretty intense. Unfortunately I was not offered a job. I was disappointed, but I know I didn't rock the interview, so I don't totally blame them.
Interview Questions: Tell me about the most difficult working relationship you have had and how you handled it.

When it was my turn to ask questions I was told the following: Training - None. Certifications - None. Yearly raises - None. This was the first interview in my career where I stopped, and wished them good luck with their search and concluded the meeting 20 minutes early.

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied via LinkedIn using the easy apply function  so I figured it was a longshot. I was pleasantly surprised to get an email from them inviting me for an interview which had to be rescheduled several times because people are out of town. I researched the job, the field, the hospital extensively talking to everyone I knew in town that was connected because I’ve heard it is an excellent place to work,  they have great benefits and the pay is generous .  HR escorted me from one person to the next. it was never clear to me what role they would play in the interview or decision making process.  Everyone I interviewed with was very warm but guarded.  The job was a little bit of a stretch for me. It seemed like they were interested.  I was thrilled when I got a call back for second interview with the people who were not available for first time. They were much more skeptical and challenging in their questions. They offered the job to someone else who I suspect was younger, cheaper (and white.)
Interview Questions: Why specifically do you want to leave your seemingly cushy job for this job?

title: Dialysis Nurse Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics (Kansas City, MO)
Interview Descriptions:
Very welcoming and very organized. The whole process was extremely professional from all phone/email interactions with HR, to meeting and interviewing with the managers (x2 interviews)

This interview was conducted as more of a conversation than a Q&A session. None of the typical "tell me about a time" questions that I had prepared to answer. Discussion of qualifications and the obvious basic stuff and basically just verifying and elaborating on my resume. Continued with more conversation including why both of us got into this specialty and what we like about it, discussed how previous HD position was similar/different to this position and why. Then toured unit and met staff. Second interview was similar but with a couple different managers from the department in the conference room. Second interview felt much more relaxed and like a "get to know you" session. Did not accept the job only because I accepted a different position :)

title: Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics
Interview Descriptions:
It was a video interview, you answer five multiple choice questions and then answer five questions on video. You are shown the question and get 30 seconds of prep time and up to 3 minutes of answer time. It made me more nervous to be recorded than I would be with a person. 

In the email it said it would take a few weeks to hear back if they were considering you for a position.
Interview Questions: What do you feel like an employer owes an employee?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics
Interview Descriptions:
Applying online is relatively easy, same procedures as most hospitals.

The interview process takes a long time to even start. Initial contact from HR took months yet I had over 5 years of pediatric experience. I received a random phone call one day from HR requesting an interview. The process now includes a self recorded initial interview which I find impersonal plus current employees are not exempt.

The actual interview itself was fine. Normal interview questions were asked and I was a given tour. This tour seemed nice but felt like I was being paraded around. I was introduced to staff which felt awkward but everyone was nice.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you dealt with a difficult coworker or family; how did you handle it?

title: PT/OT Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics
Interview Descriptions: make sure to follow up with recruiters..they are very helpful and call back with additional information on the orientation process.  Make sure to follow up with your interest level as they get a lot of applications.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to leave your current job?  What do you not like about your current manager?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics
Interview Descriptions: Starts with the online application, then video interview, and personal interview. The video interview is very simple, they only ask about 9 questions from which like 3 or 4 are recorded video and the rest is typing.
Interview Questions:
The questions were actually not that difficult. They covered professional and personal information as well as how you react in a certain type of situation.
The only aspect I did not like about the experience is that, to the moment, I have not confirmation of whether I got the job or not.

title: Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics (Kansas City, MO) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, I had a fairly quick response. I did a video interview, that went well. I received an email thanking me for my interest. 3 months later I have a face to face interview with 2 of the hiring managers!
Interview Questions: What has been one of the biggest challenges you have faced and how did you overcome it?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics (Kansas City, MO) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: First step after online application is a video interview.  This sounds intimidating, but just prepare like for any other interview and ensure you have a quiet, simple, well-lit area to record it in.  After that I worked with a recruiter who was helpful but did make some mistakes, including setting me up for an interview with a manager for a position that was not the work schedule I have indicated availability for.  However, when that did not work out, I was quickly (within 10 days) scheduled for an interview in another area that was hiring for the schedule I wanted.  For me the process was quick, I think less than a month from video interview to start date.
Interview Questions: I don't really recall...I think it is important to be strong on why you want to work for CMH and what specific skills you have that make you a great candidate.

title: Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Have not been hired yet. I applied online, got quick response to be invited to do video interview (to be completed within 48 hours. Then, next day I got quick response to video interview saying my application was forwarded onto hiring manager for consideration. FINGERS CROSSED! :):):):):) BEST HOSPITAL IN KC, MO!
Interview Questions: Was no hard or difficult questions. The only unexpected part was the video interview, because I had never done one before! :) Overall GREAT experience, was nervous for the interview for nothing!

title: Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics
Interview Descriptions: Filed out online application, got an email two days later asking that I do a video interview within 48 hrs.   It's not with an hr person on the other side of the screen.  You get to practice by answering some random questions that hr won't see. You tape your responses and the hr person will review on their own time.  I was asked 5 multiple choice questions (what days/shifts are you available) that I didn't have to tape a response for, just click for your response. Then I was asked to respond on video about a time that was stressful, what I thought employers should offer their employees in the workplace, and give an example of your organization skills.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you were stressed in the workplace

title: Security Officer II Transportation Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics
Interview Descriptions:
Interview and Hiring Process can be lenghting, be patient and conduct follow up inquiries.
This company is very much into customer service friendly environment (Children Hosptial).
I was hired and have been working for any years.
Interview Questions: Interview questions where pretty standard questions. Nothing to complicated.

title: Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics (Kansas City, MO) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: For the PICU First you meet with a small group with a few nurses and another care Assistant, then you meet with the managers. The interviews are always during the day even for night positions.
Interview Questions: How will you handle death?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics
Interview Descriptions: Very hard to get on here unless you know someone.  I called and called for months before I just called HR myself to set up an interview.
Interview Questions: There were not any difficult or unexpected questions during the interview.

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics (Kansas City, MO) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Asked about experience and career goals. Had an over the phone interview to begin with, and ended up having two in-person interviews. The first was a one-on-one with the hiring/lab manager, and the other was a interview with the group.
Interview Questions: What research experience I had

title: Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics (Kansas City, MO) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: 1-2 rounds of interview. Sometimes interviewed by Surgeons who so not have much hold on laboratory research.
Interview Questions: technical questions asked by doctors or physicians

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics (Kansas City, MO) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process including meetings with multiple individuals including the manager, direct supervisor, and HR contact as well.  The overall process took about 3-4 hours total (a bit longer than anticipated via HR communication), but overall it seemed appropriate for the position they were interviewing for.
Interview Questions: Previous work and education history, ability to handle hospital environment.

title: Media Relations Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics (Kansas City, MO) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and heard back relatively quickly. I initially applied for another intern position, but the person I interviewed with thought I was better suited for media relations and referred me to that department. I went in for another interview and it was a perfect fit.
Interview Questions: Who is the most challenging person you have had to work with?

title: Trainee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics
Interview Descriptions: group interviews with different members of the department conducted over the course of one day, standard interview, asked about background info, training, interests
Interview Questions: Most questions were very straight forward, describe career plans and goals

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics (Kansas City, MO) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Awful experience. Rude and would not contact me back about the position. You're wasting your time taking the $13.50 per hour they pay unless you're young, uneducated or desperate. I have a much better position, so thank GOD I didn't receive an offer and stupidly accept it.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a difficult Manager or leader

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics (Kansas City, MO) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via my email address first.  I then responded and the HR personnel scheduled the interview. I arrived was given a medication calculation test and did a 1:1 interview with the HR recruiter. Asked a lot of questions, tried to find out who I was as a person and what I was looking for in an employer. Then went for an interview in the unit I applied for.  Met the manager in the front lobby and was escorted to the unit - at which time we went to the desk and was introduced to employees who were then asked to the interview if they wanted.  Ended up being a group interview...interviewed by 5 employees and the manager. Was impressed with the "team work" attitude and not one negative was said by the employees.  HR seemed a bit disorganized but learned as the day progressed a front office person was sick.
Interview Questions: What can you provide us as a company that someone else may not be able too?

title: Director of Nursing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics (Kansas City, MO) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions:
This was about the 5th position I had interviewed for after leaving the company and returning 6 years later.  It was very frustrating to not get interviews for positions that weren't in management or administration; because that is what I did previously, there was an assumption that they knew better than I did what job would suit me best.

I first interviewed with HR and then was scheduled to interview with all the "stakeholders" in the department; I had a series of about 6 interviews over a period of 6 - 7 hours. I knew some of the people conducting the interviews from previously; others I had never met. There were people on the interview schedule that really did not have any business being asked to give their opinion on whether I was right for the job. I interviewed with a group of nurse who would be reporting to me should I get the position. They were not well prepared for the interview and for the most part wanted to know if I would be an advocate for nursing. Physicians are also notoriously poor interviewers and asked very few meaningful questions. I was warned by my boss that if I accepted the position, I would be "cleaning up a mess."  A mess was an understatement! I live in Kansas City, so the interview did not involve travel, etc.

As a hiring manager, I can speak briefly to the process for out of town applicants.  Providers, whether they are APRNs or physicians, are flown in all expenses paid including air fare, hotel right across from the hospital, meals and transportation to and from the hospital. The interview day (for APRNs) or days (for MDs) are full-days with interviews with multiple individuals and usually one group interview. You are usually taken out to dinner at one of the top restaurants in the city. The relocation package for this group is very good, including a tour of the city to see where you might want to live and assistance finding a Realtor, etc .

Questions vary greatly depending on the department you are interviewing with, but there are usually a lot of behavioral questions, as well as questions that attempt to get your experience in dealing with key aspects of your job as well as your clinical skills and knowledge base.

HR does a very thorough job of discussing benefits and providing written information to review afterwards. There is an opportunity to negotiate salary; most other aspects of the benefit package are non-negotiable.
Interview Questions: Are you a nursing advocate and if so, please provide examples of situations when you went to bat for your nursing staff. One does not want to come off as "aggressive" while still letting nurses know you will be an advocate for them by listening and passing on their concerns to your supervisor or physicians (biggest concern). In my experience, while most interviewees know how to answer the question, they don't know how to put into action if offered the position

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Mercy Hospitals and Clinics in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: I had already been working for this employer as a Care Assistant. It was fairly easy to get a job interview as an internal candidate.  From what I have heard from others, it is pretty hard to get an interview if you don't know anyone who already works there.
Interview Questions: Do you plan on getting your BSN.
